title: Commending the Liberty Middle School 7th and 8th Grade Band and Middle School Jazz Ensemble on their participation in Music in Our Schools Month on March 23, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  the Liberty Middle School 7th & 8th
Grade Band and Middle School Jazz Ensemble upon the  occasion  of  their
participation in Music in Our Schools Month on March 23, 2011

WHEREAS,  The  administration  of  the  Liberty Central School District,
including David L. Burke, President of the Board of  Education,  Michael
Vanyo,  Superintendent  of  Schools,  Carol Napolitano, Assistant Super-
intendent of Schools, and Lorine Lamerand, Business Manager, are commit-
ted to actively promoting and nurturing a full and  comprehensive  music
program for all students; and
  WHEREAS,  Mary  T.  Greynolds,  Principal of Liberty Middle School and
Richard A. Schacher, Assistant Principal of Liberty Middle  School,  and
Gary  E. Siegel, Director of Music, have been supportive of the school's
music education program; and
  WHEREAS, Gary E. Siegel, Director of the Liberty Middle School  7th  &
8th  Grade  Band and Liberty Middle School Jazz Ensemble, has encouraged
his students to perform at their highest level; and
  WHEREAS, The Liberty Middle School 7th & 8th  Grade  Band  and  Middle
School Jazz Ensemble are comprised of students of great intellectual and
musical talent; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Liberty  Middle  School 7th & 8th Grade Band and Middle
School Jazz Ensemble will be performing on March 23, 2011 at the  Empire
State Plaza in Albany in celebration of Music in Our Schools Month; and
  WHEREAS, The New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) sponsors
this  event  and  has helped it to evolve from a New York State Day to a
month-long national observance; and
  WHEREAS, Dedication, hard work and countless hours  of  practice  have
made  these  fine  musical ensembles the outstanding musical talent they
are today; and
  WHEREAS, The members work hard at their  music  rehearsals,  classroom
assignments  and  practice sessions, fully aware that the amount of time
and energy they are willing to expend directly affects  the  quality  of
their music; and
  WHEREAS, The members and their parents and teachers can be justifiably
and  extremely  proud of their musical achievements and in their partic-
ipation in Music in Our Schools Month; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
extend  a  warm  welcome  to the teachers and students of Liberty Middle
School as they visit Albany for their performance at  the  Empire  State
Plaza; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to David L. Burke, President of the Board of Education; Michael
Vanyo, Superintendent of Schools;  Carol  Napolitano,  Assistant  Super-
intendent  of Schools; Lorine Lamerand, Business Manager; Mary T.  Grey-
nolds, Principal and Richard A. Schacher,  Assistant  Principal  of  the
Liberty Middle School; and Gary E. Siegel, Director of Music.
